attributes.action: To debate the political impartiality of the Speaker of the House of Commons.
attributes.background: The Speaker of the House of Commons is meant to be impartial. Our Parliament successfully functions because of a set of values, rules and processes. Infringing these rules undermines Parliamentary Democracy and the Institution of Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: MPs should consider the Speakers' recently expressed opinion on foreign policy matters, particularly his hostile position to a US Presidential address and his welcoming stance in relation to countries with a history of human rights abuse including China, Singapore, Indonesia and Kuwait. His inconsistent tolerance of applause in the Commons (acceptable at the end of his own speech and not at the end of SNP speeches) should also be considered.

attributes.action: To put extra funding into the NHS .
attributes.background:
We all know about the plight of the NHS , stop using it as a political football , too many Governments past and present have failed the NHS .
At least bring us into line with other European countries as far as funding goes.
Suspend foreign aid or increase Income Tax and N.I. Contributions.

attributes.action: Get blocked up or unused property made available to the homeless
attributes.background: There are thousands of unused properties throughout the UK and there are thousands of homeless people. Open the unused properties and via a charity, make these properties available to the homeless.

attributes.action: Ban the advertising of Alcohol on UK TV.
attributes.background:
The UK Government are living in the dark ages, they have put a clear ban on all Tobacco products, banning smoking in public places and at work, Banning all TV adverts for Tobacco products.

Alcohol should be banned, there are more kids Drinking in 2017 than there are Smoking.

Alcohol is worse.
attributes.additional_details:
Go to you local street corner and look at the kids and what they are doing PM's.

Most of them are getting pissed only 2 out of 5 will be smoking.

Get a grip on real life and wake up.

attributes.action: Action by parliament to stop the proliferation of graffiti in towns and cities.
attributes.background: Graffiti on buildings Is endemic throughout the UK. Measures should be place to stop this anti social practice and clean up the mess created. This should involve hefty fines, community service to remove graffiti and imprisonment for repeat offenders.

attributes.action: MPs must have a vote on our proposed deal before reaching the EU parliament.
attributes.background: We must give our MPs the right to scrutinise the deal we're offering BEFORE the European parliament. We must show unity as a nation when going about Brexit talks and show the entire EU that any deal we proposed is back by Westminster.

attributes.action: Make all drinks producers  replace plastic containers with glass bottles.
attributes.background: Many years ago,all drinks were sold in glass bottles with very little effect on the environment,unlike the plastic containers which are causing serious pollution,especially in seas and oceans.
attributes.additional_details: A deposit scheme could be introduced to ensure most bottles were returned for re-cycling.

attributes.action: Make it so students can choose a certain method for exams.
attributes.background: Make it so that students can take one of four options for exams at A-level and GCSE: Written, Vocal, Coursework base or practical in as many subjects as possible and the student can decide what type of examination method they want to be tested by.

attributes.action: Revoke requiring military personnel to swear Oath to the Monarchy & God.
attributes.background:
I considered joining the Navy Reserves until I discovered you are required to swear and Oath of Alliegence to the Monarch and God. 
I feel this shouldn't be in place as it can prevent people from wanting to join. An oath to the Monarchy and religious beliefs should not interfere with service.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oath_of_Allegiance_(United_Kingdom)#Armed_forces

attributes.action: Install adequately bright street-lighting on all stretches of all UK highways.
attributes.background:
Driving on motorways or on any roads during nighttime can be extremely difficult when the roads are not adequately lit up.
This problem is more severe during the winter period when the nights are longer, darker and prone to complicated weather conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount of drivers using the roads of Great Britain is expanding constantly and the issue of desperately required lighting on all stretches of highways during night hours, which affects millions on a daily, or nightly, basis must be urgently addressed.
This urgent matter affects motorways and all grades of well used roads.

attributes.action: Get Patients The Right to Appeal Removal From G.P Surgery
attributes.background:
As it stands G.Ps can have a patient removed from their list simply by requesting this.
They can cite various reasons, aggressive behaviour , breakdown of Doctor Patient relationship.

The Patient has absolutely no right to appeal or even refute allegations made against them.
attributes.additional_details:
If any individual is accused of anything they should have the right to defend themselves.

In less than one year I have been removed twice & both times the reasons given were downright blatant lies.

attributes.action: Capital gains tax should be levied on the sale of second homes.
attributes.background: The housing crisis is being exacerbated by the out of control practice of residential property being traded as a capital gains tax free investment. Every aspect of UK society would benefit by a capital gains tax being levied on the sale of all second homes.

attributes.action: Increase UK Summer School Holidays By at Least 1-2 weeks
attributes.background: We don't get long enough holidays but schools and local authorities feel they have the need to fine us just because we leave school at least a week early. I understand education Is vital, but at least let us leave school for the summer as soon as we have finished our final exams.
attributes.additional_details: With all respect i believe it is very unfair, in the summer i would like to be seeing my family abroad not doing exams 3 weeks early then just doing nothing at school. Most Countries Including America get like 3 month holidays i am not asking for that. I am just asking for you to consider my request that we can leave school for the holidays as soon as we finish our exams. However, I understand that in some occasions it may not be possible, but i am asking you to please consider this.

attributes.action: Alcohol inflicted, minimum fee of £1,000.for Ambulance.
attributes.background:
I am a UK Citizen and  Retired with an Engineering background of 55 years or more.  
I have my First Aid Certificate which has come in very useful as on two occasions I have managed to keep two people alive, ( one from Drowning and one from  Car Accident ).
attributes.additional_details: I have various References From previous Employers over the years,  also from Solicitor and other Professional Bodys,  available if requested.

attributes.action: Get rid of the national speed limit sign and just put the speed limit.
attributes.background: For example when you are driving you shouldn't have to work out the speed limit it should be on the sign it works for all the other speed limits so I don't see why it can't work for 60 and 70 mph roads

attributes.action: Put the Investigatory Powers Bill to a referendum.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Bill is a piece of legislation that seriously infringes our right to a private life. The bill has been scarcely covered in the media and I believe that the British people should be given the opportunity to decide for themselves whether we are willing to give up our freedoms.
attributes.additional_details:
I urge everyone who reads this to do some extra research on the Investigatory Powers Bill, and other similar mass surveillance programs around the world, such as the NSA's Prism program. Please look up interviews from Edward Snowden and decide for yourself whether he is a traitor or a hero.

If the people decide that these programs and losing our rights are a worthy sacrifice for protection from terrorism then so be it, however, as it stands we have not been given a choice.

attributes.action: Make armed forces pay similar or inline with those in public services.
attributes.background: The fact that the armed forces personnel are away from families and loves ones and are only on or around £19000 p/a. This is with no overtime rates and to work unsociable hours and long periods of time away. Commitment bonuses are lessoning and and advance trade pay is non existent to better the job

attributes.action: Abolish VAT and instead increase corporation tax
attributes.background:
VAT stunts growth of SME's

Raising tax based on profits would encourage enterprise and encourage and help businesses of all sizes to grow.

attributes.action: Stop intelligence sharing with the USA and recall the UK Ambassador to the USA.
attributes.background: Suspend intelligence sharing with the USA to ensure that President Trump's new policy of religious discrimination is in no way assisted by the UK.The UK should also condem these actions by recalling the ambassador.
attributes.additional_details:
If we should learn anything from the Holocaust it is that descrimination based on religious beliefs is wrong and dangerous. 

"First they came for the Socialists, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Socialist. 
Then they came for the Trade Unionists, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Trade Unionist.
Then they came for the Jews, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Jew.
Then they came for me- and there was no one left to speak for me." Martin Niemöller

attributes.action: Remove the ban on owning Dogo argentinos,
attributes.background: Since 1991 this breed has been banned in the UK under the dangerous dogs act 1991, I propose that this law to either be heavily changed or removed, as people are becoming more aware that with this specific species the dogs themselves are not the problem, but the people that misuse and abuse them.
attributes.additional_details: Dogo argentinos are used as family dogs and guard dogs In their native country, just like GSD's, dobermann's and Rottweilers, they are renowned for their loyalty, and maternal instincts, to ban on dog because it looks menacing is wrong, as it promotes people to keep them for all the wrong reasons, just like every other dog consistent training and socialisation makes them perfect pets and companions, they are smart and are a reward to own because of their close loving bond with their owners.

attributes.action: Any public promise made by any holder of public office to be legally binding.
attributes.background: Holders of public office frequently promise to act on behalf of those who, ultimately employ them.  They also frequently break those promises, usually with impunity.  This lessens public trust and engagement, particularly in the field of politics.
attributes.additional_details: When a public figure makes a promise they are, essentially, making a contract with those people who employ them, elect them, or pay their salaries.  In response to these promises, we elect them, or allow them to retain their position - it is only fair and right that they should be required to stick to their promises, and yet, time and again, they do not.  There is not, at the moment, any realistic sanction available to us to prevent this, so I am proposing that there should be.

attributes.action: Reconstruct The Crystal Palace
attributes.background: The Crystal Palace was an impressive architectural feat with a design that was arguably ahead of its time.  This impressive piece of Victorian heritage was cruelly destroyed by fire in 1936, depriving too many from ever having seen it in all it's glory.  Please re-build this long lost treasure.
attributes.additional_details:
The Crystal Palace was first constructed in 1851 in Hyde Park for the Great Exhibition, which showcased new technology from the Industrial Revolution. It was moved to the Sydenham/Penge area in 1854 and opened by Queen Victoria.  

As an attraction the Crystal Palace showcased a wide variety of festivals and events.  Reconstructing the Palace would be a fantastic opportunity to reinvigorate the area as a cultural hub and return a part of our history that should never have been lost.

attributes.action: Bring back EMA money allowance for college students.
attributes.background: College students in need of money in order to support themselves instead of living off the bare minimum.

attributes.action: Protect employee privacy by making electronic monitoring illegal
attributes.background: In some companies employees are tracked so closely that their managers can see if they pause between tasks or, even stop for a chat. Some companies are even monitoring workers metabolism. Some use 'badges worn by employees to record their movements, interactions and “speaking patterns”
attributes.additional_details:
Employment monitoring article https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/jan/20/digital-giants-workers-robots-film-employee-monitoring-the-circle

BBC news Which! Report on personal data being sold. http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-38694016

New York Times
https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/18/technology/data-crunching-is-coming-to-help-your-boss-manage-your-time.html

attributes.action: To stop the £1,000 immigration skills charge for workers outside the EU
attributes.background:
The Immigration Minister Robert Goodwill has suggested.
A £1,000 immigration "skills charge" is being brought in this April for firms recruiting workers from outside the EU. This means that when we leave the EU, the 3 million EU citizens, who live in this country may have to pay this too.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-38581873

attributes.action: Make driving lessons a part of the education system for 16-18 year olds
attributes.background: making driving a part of the education system could potentially lower the amount of car accidents on the roads involving young people. many people have an accident in their first year of driving, teaching young people about the dangers of driving at a younger age could prevent this.

attributes.action: Lower the tax rate for health care workers
attributes.background: I request that the government consider lowering the tax rate of 20% over the threshold to 15% for health care workers on lower wages such as care assistance, Nurses. Currently health care workers are many paid at the living wage.

attributes.action: Prime Ministers should explain why they have not implemented their manifesto
attributes.background: Governments regularly never implement manifesto pledges. Create a law that forces The Prime Minister before a General Election to explain to Parliament why pledges have not been implemented as described.
attributes.additional_details: Trust in politicians is at an all time low, people do not believe what they say. This simple law will encourage political parties to create a manifesto that they can realistically implement. I'm tired of politicians broken promises.

attributes.action: Ban deer hunting
attributes.background: Hunting is cruel and unnecessary it causes pain and suffering many deer endure prolonged and painful death when they are injured but not killed by hunters This violent form of "entertainment" leaves countless orphaned or badly injured when hunters miss their target quick kills are rare
attributes.additional_details: A British study of deer hunting found that 11 percent of deer killed by hunters die only after being shot two or more times and that some wounded deer suffer for more than 15 minutes before dying

attributes.action: Lower the legal drinking age to 17
attributes.background: Lowering the legal drinking age could reduce & tackle the problem of binge drinking in the UK - as well as help young people socially as young school leavers can find it difficult to find friends of a similar age in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details: There are multiple reasons for this action to be taken. One reason being that lowering the legal drinking age could prevent people binge drinking when they finally reach 18 years, for example, like a child who's only been allowed fruit & vegetables being let loose at a party full of sweets. In other countries such as France, Germany & Belgium, the legal drinking age is 16 - although a restriction is kept on spirits until 18. I feel that the UK should be keeping up with other countries.

attributes.action: Make tips tax free for waiters and waitresses.
attributes.background: Currently waiters and waitresses have to declare their tips to HMRC. These tips do not form part of the bill and are a thank you gift to the waiter or waitress for providing a great service and working unsociable hours. HMRC will still generate tax revenues from the bill.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing the waiter or waitress to take the money home that night will avoid unscrupulous employers charging them admin fees on tips or taking a share for breakages and spillages.

attributes.action: Delay plans for harsh voter ID trials until it passes a public consultation
attributes.background: In wake of the recent tower hamlets scandal, the government is trialling plans for photo voter ID laws, which would undermine democracy and disenfranchise millions of voters
attributes.additional_details: This sets a very dangerous precedent, with the possibility that many people who do not own or are unable to get a passport or driving license are not able to exercise their democratic rights, voter registration laws have already been tightened and this signals a worrying first step toward an american style system wherein voter ID laws are passed simply to prevent certain demographics from voting, these plans need at least a public consultation or some sort of free photo ID to be provided

attributes.action: Ban cyclist strobe lights and flashing lights.
attributes.background: We all know the lights, the ones that blind you and flash at you and distract you whilst driving. A dimmer, non-flashing light would be much safer, the amount of people I have seen driving get distracted by those lights are ridiculous!

attributes.action: Introduce stricter laws & screening on people receiving benefits/social housing
attributes.background: Taxpayers contribute to the upkeep of social housing and benefits system. Many people on benefits abuse the system and many people living in council properties actually let the property out or do not look after / damage the property which then will have to be repaired and paid for by taxpayers.
attributes.additional_details: Experience in construction industry.

attributes.action: Drink in customers use of takeaway cups to be banned due to high waste volume
attributes.background: I work for one of the large chain high street coffee shops and I find it  astounding how much waste is created in these establishments alone, the worst needless waste I have seen is customers requesting takeaway cups to sit in. This needs to stop or legislation brought in to discourage this.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3 Billion disposable coffee cups are used every year in the UK with only 1% being recycled. It is becoming an issue which can not be ignored. I understand that asking people to not use takeaway cups and bring their own is unrealistic but stopping the use of takeaway cups for sit in customers would be a fantastic start towards ending the practice and the needless waste created.

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/mar/16/takeaway-coffee-cups-recycle-environment-waste

attributes.action: Reduce income tax paid on bonus payments
attributes.background:
We work hard to achieve a bonus at work, however the tax that we are paying on bonuses is nearly a third including NI contributions.

Bonuses are achieved by companies and/or individuals doing well in their career and they deserve to earn their full reward for this.

attributes.action: Dont allow food companies to add air to food packages to make them look bigger.
attributes.background: Food manufacturers are filling food packages with air. This is wrong as we are being tricked to buying food and finding out that in food packaging a small percentage is actual food and a large percentage is filled with air! Food with packaging should have a limit to the amount of air it has.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence that manufacturers are filling food packages with air-

http://www.msn.com/en-gb/foodanddrink/foodnews/shocking-x-ray-images-reveal-how-food-manufacturers-are-cheating-shoppers-by-filling-packages-with-air/ar-AAltXRN?li=AAcVLvg&ocid=spartandhp

attributes.action: Ban the Broadcasting of Animal Abuse for Entertainment on Television
attributes.background: This petition calls for the government to place a ban on the broadcasting on television of animal abuse for the purposes of entertainment. It would not include other reasons - such as for charitable and educational purposes.

attributes.action: Pubs closed from 27th to 30th Dec for service staff to have a Christmas break
attributes.background: Worked in hospitality all my life, never had time to be with family over Xmas, why should we not have a few days off.

attributes.action: The government to legislate that all Local Authorities Provide Public Toilets.
attributes.background: To many Local Authorities are closing Public Toilets,to try and save money caused by the governments cut backs. The people of the UK deserve to have the essential use of public toilets. Local Authorities need to be accountable for this Public Service.

attributes.action: treat addiction as a mental health problem rather than criminal justice problem
attributes.background: The war on drugs has been a war fought with misinformation. We should not punish addicts but treat their addiction and what they choose to escape from when under the influence of substance abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Chasing the scream by Johann Hari

attributes.action: Allow "hoverboards" to be used on pavements
attributes.background: Currently hoverboards are not allowed on the public pavements. Many countries such as the USA and other EU countries are allowing it and they are after all a useful mode of transport. Unfortunately an out of date highways act says that we can't and it's high tide this is changed.

attributes.action: Enforce child protection regulations on all businesses and organisations.
attributes.background: In light of the recent exposure of sexual abuse of children in football there needs to be a way. Child protection appears as a haphazard control with many organisations failing to offer the most basic protection
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be enforceable rules
All adults must have a DBS
All companies and organisations should be registered with an official body, e.g. Ofsted. All credentials must nbe verified especially when used in advertising and websites. Child referees must be registered with the local authority ( the FA refuse to accept responsibility for children who work as referees) The current position of stating if the parents allow it must be revoked as parents expect official bodies to make competent decisions on their behalf.

attributes.action: Enable Greater Flexible Working For Parents.
attributes.background: The cost of childcare is not the only barrier influencing parents returning to work (that's another story). Many parents find it incredibly difficult to get a job due to the rigidity of working hours. We shouldn't have to choose between going to work or being a parent. Let's change that!
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can only apply for flexible working arrangements when you have been in employment for 26 weeks. Many job seeking parents cannot work prescribed hours and care for a family, and so they are excluded from the job market. 
Rigid working hours exclude many parents from contributing to society and contributing to their family income.
Enable employers to offer greater flexibility with working hours for parents from the start. Enable flexible start and finish times, not prescribed hours.

attributes.action: Make the carrying and use of self defence weapons legal for woman in the U.K.
attributes.background: In the UK it's illegal to own, carry or use self defence weapons such as CS gas or pepper spray.  Statistics for violent and sexual crimes are on the rise with more woman being attacked each day. A system needs to be put in place where woman can legally own, carry and use self defence weapons.
attributes.additional_details:
http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
http://www.bsdgb.co.uk/index.php?Information:Law_Relating_to_Self_Defence

attributes.action: Allow some freedom of movement in any UK-EU trade deal
attributes.background: The UK voted to leave to control immigration but that makes a UK-EU trade deal unlikely. The UK government should allow some degree of freedom of movement so we have full single market access. This is means we are able to trade freely yet have some control on EEA immigration.
attributes.additional_details: We should allow free movement of citizens only on the basis that they have paid taxes and NI for 5 years before claiming welfare. They will only be allowed non urgent healthcare if they reside for at least 6 momths. We will allow EEA students to study under Erasmus but introduce a EEA school permit so they will need to pay an annual fee for state education. This reduces pull factor yet it doesn't violate free movement laws. We can compromise on EU structural funds.

attributes.action: To stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998
attributes.background: As part of my citizenship coursework, I am doing a campaign around stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998 and having the law replaced with the British Bill of Rights.

attributes.action: Call to ban any form of media that incites xenophobia, racism or hate.
attributes.background: There should be no tolerance to established media holding extreme, sensationalist views that provoke racial segregation, inequality and hatred toward others.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 we should not be using or allowing history to be a light suggestion of how to move forwards in becoming a more balanced and fair society that extends its care not just to the perimeters of its own towns and countries but to the entire world. We live in a multicultural society that extends to a multicultural world and we cannot continue to allow low rate tabloids or any other form of media to provoke anger in to people that gives rise to views of racism and segregation and fuels hatred.

attributes.action: Save Scotland's Military bases
attributes.background: The Government has decided that 8 of Scotland's Military Bases will close within the the next 16 yrs. This is unacceptable! We in Scotland have some of the best fighting forces in the world, but due to a shortsighted Tory regime, they are going to remove most of our capabilities!

attributes.action: The prohibition of  vehicle drivers smoking whilst driving
attributes.background: Drivers concentration must be  affected by smoking whilst driving.Observation  over many years show drivers smoking are often  using one hand to control the vehicle- lighting up and extinguishing the cigarette  must further affects drivers concentration
